title: Sweet Anita: Tourette's queen of Twitch
description: Anita broadcasts to thousands every week, playing games whilst talking Tourette's and mental health.

title: How we can all get more high-quality sleep
description: The pandemic has led to a sharp increase in insomnia, but some firms are now helping their staff.

title: Kepa goes from shootout villain to Super Cup hero
description: Kepa Arrizabalaga's time at Chelsea has been defined by an incident involving a substitution with penalties looming - and now another, but in much happier circumstances.

title: How North American cities are bracing for more heatwaves
description: Local governments are getting creative when it comes to tackling frequent and extreme heat.

title: Tokyo 2020: Meet Tokyo's youngest Olympic champion
description: Japan's Momiji Nishiya won the first women’s street skateboarding gold in the sport's Olympic debut.

title: The shopkeeper saving his island from wildfires
description: Spyros isn't a firefighter, but when his home was threatened with wildfires, he decided to take action.

title: Afghanistan war: Do the Taliban want to conquer or compromise?
description: The BBC speaks to two high profile figures in its chain of command who have very different messages.

title: Wildfires: How Portuguese club Tondela drove through the flames
description: In Tondela, the bond between club and fans was at its strongest during the night in October 2017 when nobody slept.

title: Konta beats third seed Svitolina at Canadian Open
description: British number one Johanna Konta fights back from a set down to defeat third seed Elina Svitolina and reach the Canadian Open third round.

title: Briton suspected of spying for Russia arrested in Germany
description: German federal prosecutors say the British man passed documents to Russian intelligence for cash.

title: UK deportation flight to Jamaica leaves with dozens reprieved
description: A plane to Jamaica chartered by the Home Office was carrying just seven passengers, lawyers say.

title: Uefa Super Cup: Chelsea defeat Villarreal on penalties in Belfast to lift trophy for second time
description: Chelsea beat Villarreal 6-5 in a penalty shootout to lift the Uefa Super Cup for a second time after a draining 120 minutes of action ends 1-1 in Belfast.

title: The Hundred: Leus du Plooy, Smriti Mandhana & David Lloyd star as Southern Brave take on Welsh Fire
description: Watch the best of Wednesday's Hundred action as Southern Brave's women and men both secure big wins against Welsh Fire at the Ageas Bowl.

title: Brave's men storm to top of table and eliminate Fire
description: Southern Brave cruise to a comfortable win over Welsh Fire which takes them to the top of the table.

title: Italy may have registered Europe's hottest temperature on record
description: If the registered reading is verified, it will be hottest temperature ever recorded in Europe.

title: University of Leeds students offered £10k and free housing to defer
description: Some courses in the university's schools of law and business are oversubscribed.

title: Sheffield girlfriend gives partner 'gift of life' kidney donation
description: Eddie Huntley has a rare disease and was on dialysis three times a week before the transplant.

title: England's Broad out of India series - Anderson a doubt for second Test
description: Stuart Broad will miss the remainder of England's series against India because of a calf tear and James Anderson is a doubt for the second Test.

title: Charles and Diana's wedding cake slice sells for £1,850
description: The 40-year-old slice of wedding cake was bought by a buyer from Leeds.

title: Coronavirus: What do we know about the artemisia plant?
description: Artemisia plant extracts have anti-malarial properties, but there's no evidence they can combat Covid-19.

title: Wildfires: How are they linked to climate change?
description: A series of major wildfires across the world has hit the headlines - how do they compare to previous years?

title: Afghanistan: The people fleeing the north for safety in Kabul
description: The Taliban has taken new territories in the north, forcing thousands out of their homes.

title: Afghanistan war: Taliban back brutal rule as they strike for power
description: Afghanistan's ex-rulers still back brutal punishments, the BBC finds as it goes behind Taliban lines.

title: National anthem: Should Wales' teams sing God Save the Queen?
description: Hen Wlad Fy Nhadau has been sung before Wales rugby internationals for 116 years.

title: Google may cut pay of US staff working from home
description: New pay calculator can assess geographical cost of remote versus office working.

title: Streatham attack: Officer 'feared for his life' in terrorist pursuit
description: A police officer describes "locking eyes" with a knife-wielding terrorist before shooting him dead.

title: David Gomoh stabbing: Gang guilty of murdering NHS worker
description: David Gomoh managed to stagger back home before dying in front of his family.

title: A-levels: Warning over private and state school gap
description: The former school recovery tsar warns of growing educational inequality as a result of the pandemic.

title: Prince Andrew can't ignore courts, says Virginia Giuffre's lawyer
description: Virginia Giuffre's lawyer says litigation is the only way to establish the Duke of York's evidence.

title: David Cameron denies lobbying for genetics firm Illumina
description: Mr Cameron encouraged Matt Hancock to speak at a conference co-hosted by Illumina before it won a government contract.

title: Avanti train wedding: The couple who said 'I do' on a 125mph train to Birmingham
description: Laura and Jane exchanged their vows on the same route they met on their first date.

title: Bilsdale transmitter fire: TV and radio for 1m off air indefinitely
description: The operators of a transmitter which serves part of northern England cannot say when it will be fixed.

title: We can win Champions League at Paris St-Germain - Messi
description: Lionel Messi says he dreams of winning the Champions League once more after joining Paris St-Germain, adding: "I think we have the team to do it here."

title: Disability campaigner stranded after hotel shower fall
description: Jennie Berry was stuck on her bathroom floor for 20 minutes after the shower seat broke.

title: Bristol Balloon Fiesta: City's largest multi-site launch
description: Around 40 hot air balloons launch from five locations across Bristol as part of Fiesta Fortnight.

title: Woman in Sydney investigated for pretending to be a doctor
description: The 27-year-old worked for eight months this year at a Sydney hospital, Australian media reports.

title: Stevie Nicks cancels gigs due to rising US Covid cases
description: The Fleetwood Mac singer, 73, is "still being extremely cautious" as the Delta variant spreads.

title: Covid vaccine: Fertility and miscarriage claims fact-checked
description: Posts claiming Covid vaccines cause miscarriages are not supported by scientific evidence.

title: Former New Zealand all-rounder Cairns in intensive care
description: Former New Zealand all-rounder Chris Cairns is in an intensive care unit at a Sydney hospital after being moved from Canberra for urgent treatment.

title: The Hundred: Women's game being transformed by new competition
description: Whether it was by accident or design - or both - women's cricket is being transformed by The Hundred, writes Isabelle Westbury.

title: The Papers: 'A-levels overhaul' and 'Williamson in danger'
description: Wednesday's papers lead with a plan to fix soaring A-level grade inflation after record-high results.

title: Kathy Hochul: Who is New York's first female governor?
description: The history-making Democrat will take the role after Andrew Cuomo resigned over harassment claims.

title: Fenty Beauty: How make-up helped Rihanna become a billionaire
description: Rihanna makes more money from her make-up than from her music and acting work.

title: The Orielles: How the band turned their album into a film score
description: The band on surreal gigs at cricket grounds and the "happenings" that inspired their new project.
